intro: Gelseminum sambucifolium, commonly known as the sweetheart vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is known for its toxic properties due to the presence of cardiac glycosides. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and potentially dangerous to handle.
